column4: Hey guys, experienced user here.  I'm running 9.10, I DONT wanna hear "upgrade, its so old" etc.  I'm sticking with 9.10 on this box because certain software just wont work otherwise, among other issues.
My issue though, is I have a broadcom chipset that normally uses the b43 chipset, sometimes the hardware switch can be wonky, and will require a reboot to get working
So I plugged in my GNexus android and did a usb tehter which works, i can surf the web.  But when i run apt-get update i get tons of errors
Like it can't connect to the server
Even when I uncomment other repos
It appears the b43 driver is installed though, cause networkmanager says "disconnected" rather than "missing firmware"
So I can continue to use 9.10
And no I DO NOT want to upgrade
we've already gotten that far
http://old-releases.ubuntu.com/ but again, it's EOL, you're at risk, not supported, yadda yadda.
thanks
it cant be any worse than running Arch using the testing repo for the past 6+ years
I'm not familiar with Arch, but the problem is security vulnerabilities that aren't patched, not necessarily general 'bugs'
that relaly isnt a problem to me, and i said earlier, 9.10 is the only one that will work with a certain app i need
So replacing most of the url with that old-releases url SHOULD work?
Or could comeone give me an example?
Because some work, some dont
nvm, i found plenty of wbesites addressing the problem
I broke my number one rule!
Aleways google before aksing in #ubuntu
archives.ubuntu.com/ubuntu (and security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu) with old-releases.ubuntu.com/ubuntu
lol
i got it
if others come in asking the same question, link to this, http://aacable.wordpress.com/2011/12/02/howto-solve-ubuntu-9-10-karmic-koala-apt-get-not-updating-error/
